document.docAuthor: Yasunaga, Tomohide, Chérot, Frédéric & Schwartz, Michael D.
document.docTitle: Malayamiridius nigrotenuis Yasunaga & Chérot & Schwartz 2021, new species
document.masterDocTitle: New genera and species of the Oriental mirine plant bugs from Southeast Asia, with six new combinations (Insecta: Heteroptera: Miridae: Mirinae: Mirini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genera and species of the Oriental mirine plant bugs from Southeast Asia, with six new combinations (Insecta: Heteroptera: Miridae: Mirinae: Mirini)

: male,
MALAYSIA :

1,100 m

.

:

:

.

caption.paragraph: Table 1. Measurements for Oriental mirine species. Abbreviations: L = length, W = width.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Recognised by fuscous chestnut brown basic colouration; creamy yellow clypeus, pro- and mesofemora, pro- and mesotibia, and abdominal sternites IV−VI, in addition to the characters mentioned in generic diagnosis.
Etymology. From Latin, niger (= black) combined with tenuis (= slender), referring to the darkened, slender body of this new species; an adjective.
Distribution. Brunei , Indonesia (northern Sulawesi and northwestern highlands of Sumatra ), Malaysia , Thailand , and Vietnam ( Fig. 12 ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4. Habitus images of
Sundacapsus flavonitidus
(A–C) and
S. kinabaluensis
(D–E). A, D, male in dorsal view; B, E, female in dorsal view; C, female in ventral view.
